alert.note: Alert for Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 8:46PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Norton and northern Graham Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 846 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Almena to 7 miles southwest of Norton to 7 miles west of Lenora. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lenora around 900 PM CDT. Almena around 905 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
